N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 399.2 - Application

State Regulations
(a) The department
and local social services district shall have the responsibility for
investigating any case of alleged fraud/intentional program violation and
ensuring that cases are acted upon in accordance with the procedures set forth
in this Part. (b) Unless
specifically granted written authorization to forego initial processing and to
proceed directly on the alleged fraud/intentional program violation by either
the local social services official or his/her authorized representative or the
district attorney of the jurisdiction on the grounds that to do otherwise would
prejudice the prosecution of the claim, local social services districts shall
initially proceed with the claim as an inadvertent household error prior to
either referral to the district attorney or processing of the claim for an
administrative disqualification hearing. A local district's failure to
demonstrate compliance with the provisions of this subdivision shall be
determinative only of the district's reimbursement and shall not affect the
department's determination at a hearing required by this Part or a court's
determination in an instance in which a claim is referred by a local social
services district to the local district attorney for prosecution. Noncompliance
with the provisions of this section shall not affect the amount of allotment
reduction authorized in section
399.9
(f) of this

Part following a hearing decision that fraud/intentional program violation has
occurred. Notes
